definition: day after day
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month

sentences.english: They returned to the store with other protesters day after day.
sentences.chinese: 他们与其他抗议者日复一日的来到这个餐馆。

sentences.english: This is why we go on, day after day, concocting fictions with utter seriousness .
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们为何日复一日，如此严肃编织小说的原因。

sentences.english: The gander circled the pond for days, and more days after that.
sentences.chinese: 那雄鹅成天围着池塘转，日复一日。

sentences.english: Day to day, choice by choice, we are building our future.
sentences.chinese: 日复一日，我们就在选择中铺垫通往未来的路。

sentences.english: It also includes day to day complaints about lack of equipment and supplies.
sentences.chinese: 它同时包括日复一日对缺少装备以及补给的抱怨。

sentences.english: Day after day, Zhang Shanqi gradually from the effects of the promotion.
sentences.chinese: 日复一日，张善奇的推广渐渐起了效果。

sentences.english: In turn, management activities should ensure that the organization's governance approach is carried out day-to-day.
sentences.chinese: 而管理活动应该确保日复一日地贯彻组织的治理方法。

sentences.english: Day by day, their spirits atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 日复一日，她们精神萎靡。

sentences.english: From one day to the next Inga is left alone with two younger siblings.
sentences.chinese: 英嘉和比她更小的两个弟妹便日复一日地孤独地生活。

sentences.english: The trial went on day after day. The decision would be close.
sentences.chinese: 针对总统的审判日复一日，裁决将非常接近。

sentences.english: Those people who live sensibly and sanely day after day.
sentences.chinese: 那些日复一日生活在机敏与理智里的人之一。

sentences.english: Oceans apart, day after day, and I slowly go insane.
sentences.chinese: 远隔重洋，日复一日，我慢慢地变得要失常。

sentences.english: Distress allusion begins to assume a responsibility that takes care of cattail, day after day.
sentences.chinese: 悲痛的典开始承担起照顾蒲的责任，日复一日。

sentences.english: You can not learn to paint without endlessly painting still lifes. Math is no different.
sentences.chinese: 没有日复一日的静物写生，你就不能够学会绘画。

sentences.english: What was it like day after day in their fetid cargo bay?
sentences.chinese: 在恶臭熏天的货舱中日复一日的生活是什么样的？

sentences.english: It's simply a great contribution that you spare a drop of water day after day.
sentences.chinese: 你要是日复一日地节约水，那都算是做了大贡献。

definition: over the years/year after year
lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
year in, year out (idiom)
dry and dull/uninteresting/dry-as-dust
for years/over the years
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to leave early and return late (idiom)
tedious/dreary
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
work/manual labor
regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
hardworking/industrious
variant of 長年累月|长年累月[chang2 nian2 lei3 yue4]
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
